articles.headline: Harvard Ideas on Health Care Hit Home, Hard
articles.snippet: While Harvard professors oppose changes that will raise their health care costs, the university says the increases are in part a result of the Affordable Care Act, which many Harvard experts championed.
articles.abstract: While Harvard professors oppose changes that will raise their health care costs, the university says the increases are in part a result of the Affordable Care Act, which many Harvard experts championed.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — For years, Harvard’s experts on health economics and policy have advised presidents and Congress on how to provide health benefits to the nation at a reasonable cost. But those remedies will now be applied to the Harvard faculty, and the professors are in an uproar.

articles.headline: Morgan Stanley Breach Put Client Data Up for Sale on Pastebin, an Online Site
articles.snippet: Morgan Stanley traced the leak to Galen Marsh, a young financial adviser, but said he did not share the data or use it for financial gain.
articles.abstract: Morgan Stanley traced the leak to Galen Marsh, a young financial adviser, but said he did not share the data or use it for financial gain.
articles.lead_paragraph: In mid-December, a posting appeared on the Internet site Pastebin offering six million account records, including passwords and login data for clients of Morgan Stanley.

articles.headline: Ferrying the Dead of Both Sides in a Cruel Afghan War
articles.snippet: Malik Abdul Hakim, who has lost two sons, is revered for collecting and returning the bodies of both Taliban and government casualties.
articles.abstract: Malik Abdul Hakim, who has lost two sons, is revered for collecting and returning the bodies of both Taliban and government casualties.
articles.lead_paragraph: KANDAHAR, Afghanistan — On the brindled plains of southern Afghanistan, Malik Abdul Hakim is death’s ferryman.

articles.headline: Apps Everywhere, but No Unifying Link
articles.snippet: As people spend more time using apps, their Internet has taken a step backward, becoming more isolated — more like the web before search engines.
articles.abstract: As people spend more time using apps, their Internet has taken a step backward, becoming more isolated — more like the web before search engines.
articles.lead_paragraph: Navigating the Internet used to mean painstakingly typing the exact address you wanted into your computer. The web browser and the search engine simplified that, giving us the Internet we take for granted today.

articles.headline: TPG Investors Pay Twice for Work on Chobani Deal
articles.snippet: Clients of TPG are paying management fees and a separate fee for a partner’s work for the yogurt maker Chobani, which borrowed $750 million from TPG last year.
articles.abstract: Clients of TPG are paying management fees and a separate fee for a partner’s work for the yogurt maker Chobani, which borrowed $750 million from TPG last year.
articles.lead_paragraph: The senior partners of Wall Street’s private equity firms typically draw their salaries from management fees paid by clients, including the nation’s biggest pension funds, whose capital they invest.

articles.headline: Defiant on Witness Stand, Times Reporter Says Little
articles.snippet: James Risen of The New York Times took the stand but did not answer any questions that could help the Justice Department identify his confidential sources.
articles.abstract: James Risen of The New York Times took the stand but did not answer any questions that could help the Justice Department identify his confidential sources.
articles.lead_paragraph: ALEXANDRIA, Va. — After losing a seven-year legal battle, James Risen, a reporter for The New York Times, reluctantly took the witness stand in federal court here on Monday, but refused to answer any questions that could help the Justice Department identify his confidential sources.

articles.headline: Oil’s Fall Continues Into 2015, and Stock Markets Shudder
articles.snippet: West Texas crude oil dipped below $50, and the Dow Jones industrial average was down more than 300 points on a day of volatility.
articles.abstract: West Texas crude oil dipped below $50, and the Dow Jones industrial average was down more than 300 points on a day of volatility.
articles.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON — Oil prices tumbled below $50 a barrel on Monday, spooking global financial markets and signaling that the remarkable 50 percent price drop since June was continuing this year and even quickening.
articles.byline: By Clifford Krauss and Peter Eavis

articles.headline: Racially Ignited, a Magical World Is Uncanny
articles.snippet: “The Wizard of Watts,” an animated musical coming to Adult Swim on Saturday, takes on greater weight as a national debate over race and overzealous policing is underway.
articles.abstract: “The Wizard of Watts,” an animated musical coming to Adult Swim on Saturday, takes on greater weight as a national debate over race and overzealous policing is underway.
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — “The Wizard of Watts,” a coming animated television musical, was conceived two years ago as a big, fat gob of raucous entertainment wrapped around a nugget of racial commentary.

articles.headline: For Flight Attendants, High Fashion Goes the Way of Free Peanuts
articles.snippet: Domestic airlines have steadily pared back trendsetting designer looks in favor of uniforms that resemble today’s more utilitarian flying experience.
articles.abstract: Domestic airlines have steadily pared back trendsetting designer looks in favor of uniforms that resemble today’s more utilitarian flying experience.
articles.lead_paragraph: If it is indeed true that you are what you wear, then consider the statement American Airlines recently made when, as part of its postmerger rebranding, it unveiled prototype uniforms for its flight attendants and other employees.

articles.headline: Palestinians Seen Gaining Momentum in Quest for Statehood
articles.snippet: Palestinians have begun to translate a series of symbolic steps made outside of negotiations into a strategy that has increased pressure on Israel.
articles.abstract: Palestinians have begun to translate a series of symbolic steps made outside of negotiations into a strategy that has increased pressure on Israel.
articles.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — When the Palestinians sought statehood at the United Nations in 2011, it was widely dismissed as a symbolic gambit to skirt negotiations with Israel and Washington’s influence over the long-running conflict. But the Palestinians have begun to translate a series of such symbolic steps, culminating in last week’s move to join the International Criminal Court, into a strategy that has begun to create pressure on Israel.

articles.headline: An Unusual Boardroom Battle, in Academia
articles.snippet: A paper by Daniel M. Gallagher and Joseph A. Grundfest takes aim at Lucian A. Bebchuk of Harvard, an advocate for changing policies that prevent shareholders from electing, or overthrowing, an entire board at once.
articles.abstract: A paper by Daniel M. Gallagher and Joseph A. Grundfest takes aim at Lucian A. Bebchuk of Harvard, an advocate for changing policies that prevent shareholders from electing, or overthrowing, an entire board at once.
articles.lead_paragraph: A normally academic question about corporate governance has erupted into a nasty, often personal battle among elite professors, regulators and white-shoe lawyers that has raised the suggestion of securities fraud on one side and abuse of authority on the other.

articles.headline: Coach Expands Luxury Fashion Brand Buying Shoemaker Stuart Weitzman
articles.snippet: The transaction is a rare acquisition by Coach, which has embarked on a turnaround that includes ending discounts and transforming itself into an upscale lifestyle brand.
articles.abstract: The transaction is a rare acquisition by Coach, which has embarked on a turnaround that includes ending discounts and transforming itself into an upscale lifestyle brand.
articles.lead_paragraph: Stuart Weitzman’s strappy sandals have graced the feet of the actresses Jennifer Lawrence and Lupita Nyong’o. The Duchess of Cambridge sports his wedge heels.
articles.byline: By Hiroko Tabuchi and Michael J. de la Merced
